readability_reflection: I found string interpolation easier to read, because I didn't have to worry about spaces and what data types I was dealing with. For instance, I know I was working on this question that had "(1+1+1+1)" and I kept thinking that it was 4. But its not, it would be "(1111)".
comprehension_debugging: Yes, with the concatenation I had to be extra careful with the whitespace. I had to put my finger up to read the lines carefully.
preference_rationale: String interpolation. I was able to easily debug and determine which option to choose. Like when it came to reading what the domain was, I was able to quickly see which was the correct option.
learning_curve: Since I have some experience with Python, I was able to do concatenation easily, but I did forget what interpolation meant. After a couple exercises, I was able to understand it.
suggestions_improvement: For interpolation I would have spaces not be a factor inside the brackets, only outside.
